intro: Lopadocalyx uliginosus, commonly known as the swamp beauty or swamp hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and thrives in moist, swampy environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Lopadocalyx uliginosus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability to wet conditions.
